title.narrative: Botswana National HIV/AIDS Prevention Support Project

description.narrative: The revised project development objective is to assist the Government of Botswana to increase access to prioritized prevention services that reduce the risk of HIV transmission.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :IBRD 75680 | Description :Annual audit reports will be submitted to the Bank by September 30 each year |Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :IBRD 75680 | Description :Borrower shall clear audit backlogs no later than eight months after the EffectiveDate for Phase I Health Districts | Due Date :28-Feb-2010
Finance Agreement :IBRD 75680 | Description :Borrower shall clear audit backlogs prior to implementation in Phase II HealthDistricts | Due Date :30-Jan-2012
Finance Agreement :IBRD 75680 | Description :Conduct a project mid-term review | Due Date :30-Dec-2011
Finance Agreement :IBRD 75680 | Description :No later than one year after effectiveness, the Borrower shall have conducted a socialanalysis for the Project | Due Date :30-Jun-2010

Finance Agreement :IBRD 75680 | Description :No later than six months after the Effective Date, the Borrower shall have recruitedall finance and accounting staff in the PublicSector Ministries and NACA necessary for Project implementation | Due Date:30-Dec-2009
Finance Agreement :IBRD 75680 | Description :No later than three months after effectiveness, NACA will recruit a 2nd financialmanagement & procurement specialist | Due Date :30-Sep-2009

title.narrative: Proportion of youth aged 15-19 years reporting condom use during the last sexual encounter with a non-regular partner in the past 12 months

comment.narrative: Source: BAIS IV Survey and Universal Access Data

title.narrative: Percentage of adults (15-49 years) who received an HIV test in the past 12 months and who know their results

comment.narrative: Source: BAIS IV survey; (Note: this indicators was reported as 41.2% in the BAIS III (2008 ) survey.

title.narrative: Percentage of population (10-64 years) who have ever received an HIV test

comment.narrative: Source: BAIS IV survey; (Note: this indicator was reported as 56.4% in the BAIS III (2008) survey.

title.narrative: Number of organizations that have been funded through the CFP mechanism in the past 12 months
Proportion of adults who report having had sex with more than one partner in the past 12 months by age group: (a) 15 to 19 years;and (b) 20 to 24 years

target.value: Adults: 15-19 years: 5.0 percent Adults 20-24 years: below 10 percent

comment.narrative: Source: BAIS IV Survey(BAIS IVA age and gender-disaggregated data will not not available until the release of the survey'sStatistical Report in July 2014)

title.narrative: Proportion of youth aged 15 to 19 years and 20 to 24 years who correctly identify ways of preventing the sexual transmission of HIV

baseline.value: Youth 15-19 years: 15.5 Youth 20-24 years 19.2 Source: DHS, 2004) (Source: DHS, 2004)

target.value: Youth 15-19 years: 50.0 Youth 20-24 years: 70.0 Source: DHS, 2004)

title.narrative: Hospitals equipped with isolation wards and functional as TB referral centers

comment.narrative: Note: Global Fund grant resources were utilized in the renovation of TB isolation wards, other than at Jubilee Hospital.

title.narrative: Number of male circumcision procedures performed in selected health facilities
Proportion of DMSACs that submit timely quarterly reports on project-supported community grants to NACA
Regional TB coordinators recruited and active in two regions
Number of primary health clinics upgraded and HAART compliant
